titlestmt.titleproper: Winchester-Moore Family papers, Inclusive: circa 1855-1972, undated, Bulk: 1922-1937, undated

note.p: © 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Papers Summary
did.abstract: The Winchester-Moore Family papers are focused on the life of Robert G. Winchester, but also include items related to his mother’s family, the Moores. The collection includes clippings, photographs, event invitations and announcements, and several other items of interest from throughout the family.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Robert Glenn Winchester and his twin brother, William Penn Winchester, were born 1905 December 18 just outside Waco, Texas, in what is now Robinson. Their parents were Mary Katherine Moore Winchester, originally of Atlanta, Georgia, and Robert Stevenson Winchester, born in Union County, North Carolina. R. S. Winchester worked for the railroad which relocated his family to Texas, spending time in Waco and Yoakum. The Winchester’s also had a younger brother, Albert.

R. G. Winchester was a Waco High School (1923) and Baylor University (1927) graduate. In 1955 he helped his mother fund a newspaper reading room in the Baylor Libraries to honor his late twin brother, William Winchester, who died in a bus-train accident while attending Baylor. In 1971, Winchester authored a book, James Pinckney Henderson: Texas’ First Governor; this was the first biography written about Pinckney.

Robert G. Winchester was a longtime teacher and Principal at Yoakum High School in Yoakum, Texas. Shortly before his death in 1980 a senior scholarship was created in his honor, “The Robert G. Winchester Outstanding Citizen Award.” Winchester died 1980 August 19 and is interred at Oakwood Cemetery in Waco, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The General series documents regular activities of the Winchester-Moore Family. Graduation announcements, newspapers and clippings, correspondence, and printed materials are available. Certificates and awards are also present, including an honorary varsity letter certificate presented to William Winchester following his death.

The Baylor University series accounts for several members of the Moore and Winchester families who attended Baylor University. Notably, William P. Winchester was a student in 1927 and lost his life in a tragic bus-train accident. Several items from his involvement as a student athlete are represented as well as a folder titled “Immortal Ten” which documents the tragedy. Other general items and clippings are also present.

The Waco Shakespeare Club series documents the activities and interests of Mrs. Mary Katherine Moore Winchester as part of the club. She served as President from 1941-1943 for which she was given a book of daily Shakespeare quotations, attended the annual conference of Women’s Clubs, and traveled to Stratford-upon-Avon where she collected several art prints of the area. Three card games inspired by the works of Shakespeare are also included.

Photographs document several generations of the Winchester-Moore family. Weddings, graduations, individual portraits, and extended family photographs are present. Also represented are several aunts, uncles, and cousins, including Henry Price (Nora Winchester’s husband) who served as a state legislator in North Carolina. Also included are photographs taken by noted Waco photographer Fred Gildersleeve.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: A previous inventory and partial finding aid existed for this collection; it was arranged in two series but did not account for several materials received later. Current arrangement includes these materials and is in four series: I. General, II. Baylor University, III. Waco Shakespeare Club, IV. Photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Winchester-Moore Family papers, Accession # 460, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Sylvia Hernandez. Released on 2020-02-11.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The General series, dated 1911-1972, includes clippings, programs and announcements, correspondence, and several oversize newspaper items. Also included are certificates, letters of recommendation, and printed materials. The series is arranged alphabetically and in good condition.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Folder 7 is restricted due to the inclusion of personal student records. Speak with an archivist for further information.

did.unittitle: Robert G. and William P. Winchester Tests and Transcripts (Restricted)

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Baylor University series, 1924-1945, includes general university related clippings as well as those related to athletics and the “Immortal Ten.” Other items include ticket stubs, rosters, and general memorabilia. The series is arranged alphabetically and in good condition.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Waco Shakespeare Club series, dated 1923-1949, includes several Shakespeare inspired card games, art prints from a trip to Stratford-on-Avon, and club by-laws. Also included are event programs, personal writings, and a book of quotations. Items are arranged alphabetically and in average to good condition.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Photographs series, dated 1855-1966, includes several generations from the Moore and Winchester families. Weddings, graduations, accomplishments, individual and family portraits are included. The series is arranged alphabetically and is in good condition.
